page.title: 16Mr Ben Jones of Pontycymer
page.content: Born in 1902, he spent most of his lifetime, for years as a teacher. His fondest memory is of the independence of the people, a close knit community united by the hardships of the common ocupation, coal mining. The early years of mining were followed by disputes aimed at improving pay and working conditions, The first nalional strike was in 1921 and as there was no Welfare State, the miners were not cushioned against the evils of unemployment. Familieslived in dire poverty. Soup kitchens in the chapel vestre; boots from the Lord Mayors fund, holiday camps for the most deserving children provided by the Local Council, all aimed at alleviating the misery.
